intro: Diplomorpha albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Diplomorpha, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Diplomorpha albiflora thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
